meanings.definition: Instructing orally, typically by asking questions and receiving answers.
meanings.sent1: The teacher was catechizing the students on the new math concept.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys catechizing her children on the importance of kindness.
meanings.sent3: The parrot started catechizing the dog on how to fetch a ball.
meanings.sent4: The coach was catechizing the players on the strategy for the upcoming game.
meanings.sent5: The wise owl was catechizing the young owlets on how to hunt for food.

meanings.definition: Teaching the principles of Christian religion, typically by asking questions and receiving answers.
meanings.sent1: The catechizing at Sunday school helped the children learn about faith.
meanings.sent2: The priest led the catechizing session for the new members of the church.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried catechizing the birds on the importance of sharing food.
meanings.sent4: The book was a catechizing tool for those wanting to learn about Christianity.
meanings.sent5: The catechizing ceremony was a solemn and meaningful event for the community.
